alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; St. James; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 7:18AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. James, northwestern Terrebonne, northwestern Lafourche and Assumption Parishes through 800 AM CDT... At 717 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Paincourtville to near Amelia. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Houma, Thibodaux, Napoleonville, Gramercy, Lutcher, Schriever, Gray, South Vacherie, Paincourtville, Convent, North Vacherie, Supreme, Chackbay, Labadieville, Bayou Cane, Belle Rose, Garyville and Raceland. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 192 and 197. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; St. James; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
